title: Customer Base Inquiry
additionalText: how many customers do we have

title: Top Customer Identification Request
additionalText:
who is our top customer
I've identified your top customer based on total lifetime value. **Roger Harui** is your highest value customer, having generated **$877,107.19** in total revenue across all their purchases.

This analysis used the customer lifetime value data, which sums all sales order line totals across each customer's entire purchase history. Roger Harui significantly outperforms other customers, with the next highest customer generating approximately $853,849 in lifetime value.

The metric shows this as an all-time analysis, providing a comprehensive view of which customer has contributed the most revenue to your business over their entire relationship with Adventure Works.

title: Customer Count Inquiry
additionalText:
how many customers do we have
I've created a metric that shows you have **19,820 customers** in total.

This count includes all customers in your database, which consists of both individual customers and store accounts. The metric displays this as a single number card showing the total customer count across all time periods.

title: Recent Sales Performance Dashboard
additionalText:
Can you put a dashboard together for me with useful graphics showing how sales is going over the last few months?
I've created a comprehensive **Sales Performance Dashboard** with 8 visualizations showing how sales is going over the last 6 months (April - September 2025).

**Dashboard Overview:**

The dashboard includes:

- **Key Metrics Summary** (Top Row): Three metric cards showing total sales revenue ($23.4M), total orders (12,407), and current month performance (September: $755K)

- **Monthly Sales Trend**: Line chart tracking revenue month-over-month, showing peak performance in August ($5.4M) and July ($5.2M)

- **Order Volume & Average Order Value**: Two trend lines showing order counts (ranging from 1,416 to 2,401 per month) and average order value (typically $550-$650)

- **Sales by Product Category**: Horizontal bar chart showing Bikes dominating at $94.7M, followed by Components ($11.8M), Clothing ($2.1M), and Accessories ($1.3M)

- **Top 10 Territories**: Horizontal bar chart highlighting Southwest ($4.5M) and Northwest ($3.5M) as the leading territories in the last 6 months

**Key Insights:**
- Total sales over the last 6 months reached $23.4M across 12,407 orders
- August and July were the strongest months with over $5M in revenue each
- September shows a significant drop to $755K, which may indicate partial month data or seasonal decline
- Bikes represent the vast majority of sales, accounting for approximately 86% of total revenue
- US territories (Southwest, Northwest, Central, Southeast, Northeast) combined represent a significant portion of sales

title: Top Customer Purchase Patterns
additionalText:
Can you build a report for me describing my Who my top customer is and what their most frequent purchases are?
I've created a comprehensive report analyzing your top customer and their purchasing patterns.

**Key Findings:**

- Your top customer is **Roger Harui** with a lifetime value of **$877,107.19**
- Roger consistently purchases **Mountain-200 series bikes** across multiple sizes (38, 42, 46) and colors (Black, Silver)
- The most frequently ordered products appear in **7-8 separate orders**, indicating strong repeat-purchase behavior
- Purchase patterns suggest Roger operates as a bike retailer, maintaining inventory across various size options

The report includes two visualizations:
1. A metric card displaying the top customer and their lifetime value
2. A horizontal bar chart showing the 10 most frequently purchased products by order count

This customer represents a highly valuable, predictable buyer with consistent ordering patterns focused on mountain bikes and components.

title: Business Performance KPI Dashboard
additionalText:
Can you build a dashboard with for me with a few KPI metrics on it.
I've created a **Business Performance KPIs** dashboard with 6 key metrics that provide a comprehensive view of your business health over the last 12 months:

**Financial Performance:**
- **Total Sales Revenue**: $49.2M - Your total revenue from all sales
- **Average Order Value**: $2,101.56 - The average value per order

**Volume Metrics:**
- **Total Orders**: 23,434 - Number of orders placed
- **Total Customers**: 18,103 - Unique customers who made purchases

**Profitability & Operations:**
- **Gross Profit Margin**: 12.2% - Your profitability after product costs
- **Order Fulfillment Rate**: 100% - Percentage of orders delivered on or before the due date

The dashboard is organized in two rows with three KPIs each, making it easy to monitor your business performance at a glance. All metrics are calculated for the last 12 months and will update automatically as new data comes in.

title: Inventory Dashboard
additionalText:
How much current inventory do I have?
I've analyzed your current inventory levels. You have **335,974 units** of inventory on hand across all products and locations in your system.

This total represents all items currently available in your warehouses and storage facilities, aggregated across all products, locations, shelves, and bins tracked in your inventory management system.
How much incoming inventory do I have?
I've analyzed your incoming inventory levels. You have **21,338 units** of incoming inventory currently on open purchase orders.

This represents products that have been ordered from vendors but not yet fully received. The incoming inventory is spread across 380 purchase order lines where deliveries are either partial or still pending, giving you visibility into your supply pipeline.
How much outgoing inventory do I have?
I've analyzed your outgoing inventory levels. You currently have **0 units** of outgoing inventory.

This is because all sales orders in your system have already been shipped. Analysis shows that all 31,465 sales orders have status 5 (Shipped), meaning there are no customer orders in "In Process," "Approved," or "Backordered" status that would represent inventory allocated to customers but awaiting shipment.

Your fulfillment process appears to be fully caught up with no pending shipments.
What about how much inventory did go out in the last month?
I've analyzed your inventory shipments for the last 30 days. **2,209 units** of inventory were shipped to customers during this period.

This represents inventory that physically left your facilities through 976 sales orders across 2,209 order line items, giving you visibility into your recent fulfillment activity and outbound inventory flow.
Can you take the last 4 metrics you created and put them on a Dashboard called Inventory Dashboard?
I've successfully created the **Inventory Dashboard** with all 4 metrics you requested:

**Row 1:**
- Total Current Inventory (335,974 units on hand)
- Total Incoming Inventory (21,338 units on order)

**Row 2:**
- Total Outgoing Inventory (0 units awaiting shipment)
- Inventory Shipped Last 30 Days (2,209 units shipped)

The dashboard provides a comprehensive overview of your inventory position, showing what you have in stock, what's coming from suppliers, what's pending for customers, and recent shipment activity.

title: Total Current Inventory
additionalText:
You currently have **335,974 units** of inventory on hand across all products and locations. This represents the total quantity of items available in your warehouses and storage facilities.## MethodologyThis metric is calculated by summing the `quantity` field from the `product_inventory` table, which tracks on-hand inventory by product and location. The quantity represents the current stock levels at the time of the last inventory update and includes all products across all storage locations, shelves, and bins in your system. Total Current Inventory
What is the total current inventory quantity across all products and locations?

title: Top Customer Analysis
additionalText:
Roger Harui's purchasing behavior reveals a clear focus on the **Mountain-200 series bikes**, which appear in 8 separate orders each across multiple sizes (38, 42, and 46) and colors (Black and Silver). This pattern suggests Roger operates as a bike retailer maintaining inventory across various size options to serve different customer needs. The consistent ordering of **HL Mountain Frames** and **ML/HL Mountain Handlebars** (appearing in 6-8 orders) indicates ongoing component purchases, likely for bike assembly, repairs, or customization services.The purchase frequency demonstrates a reliable, repeat-buying pattern with the same core products appearing across multiple orders, making Roger a highly predictable and valuable customer for inventory planning and relationship management.## MethodologyThis analysis identified the top customer using the `customer_all_time_clv.metric_clv_all_time` field, which represents the sum of all `sales_order_detail.linetotal` values across the customer's entire order history. Customer identity was enriched by joining to the `person` table via `customer.personid` to obtain the customer's name.Purchase frequency was calculated by counting distinct `sales_order_header.salesorderid` values for each product purchased by the top customer. This metric represents how many separate orders contained each product, providing insight into which items the customer purchases most consistently over time. Products were identified by joining `sales_order_detail` to `product` on `productid`. Top Customer by Lifetime Value
Identifies the customer with the highest all-time lifetime value

title: Total Incoming Inventory
additionalText:
You currently have **21,338 units** of incoming inventory on open purchase orders. This represents products that have been ordered from vendors but not yet fully received into your warehouses.This incoming inventory is spread across **380 purchase order lines** where the ordered quantity exceeds the received quantity, indicating partial or pending deliveries.## MethodologyThis metric is calculated by summing the outstanding quantity on all purchase order lines from the `purchase_order_detail` table. The outstanding quantity is determined by subtracting `receivedqty` from `orderqty` for each purchase order line where items are still pending receipt. This gives you visibility into inventory that is in transit or awaiting delivery from your suppliers. Total Incoming Inventory
What is the total incoming inventory quantity on open purchase orders?

title: Total Outgoing Inventory
additionalText:
You currently have **0 units** of outgoing inventory. This means there are no customer orders awaiting shipment in your system.Analysis of your sales order data shows that **all 31,465 sales orders** in the system have already been shipped (status = 5). There are no orders in "In Process," "Approved," or "Backordered" status that would represent inventory allocated to customers but not yet shipped.## MethodologyThis metric is calculated by summing the `orderqty` from `sales_order_detail` for all sales orders where the order status is less than 5 (not yet shipped). Order statuses include: 1 = In Process, 2 = Approved, 3 = Backordered, 4 = Rejected, 5 = Shipped, 6 = Cancelled. Since all orders in your current dataset have status 5 (Shipped), there is no outgoing inventory awaiting fulfillment. Total Outgoing Inventory
What is the total outgoing inventory quantity on unshipped sales orders?

title: Inventory Shipped Last 30 Days
additionalText:
In the last 30 days, **2,209 units** of inventory were shipped to customers. This represents inventory that left your facilities through **976 sales orders** across **2,209 order line items**.This outbound inventory flow provides visibility into your recent fulfillment activity and can be used to track inventory turnover and demand patterns.## MethodologyThis metric is calculated by summing the `orderqty` from `sales_order_detail` for all sales orders where the `shipdate` falls within the last 30 days (from today's date). The shipdate represents when the order was actually shipped to the customer, providing an accurate measure of inventory that physically left your facilities during this period. Inventory Shipped Last 30 Days
What is the total inventory quantity shipped in the last 30 days?

additionalText: What is the total number of customers?

title: Total Customer Count
additionalText:
How many customers do we have?
I've created a report showing your total customer count. **Adventure Works has 19,820 customers** in the system. This includes both individual customers and store accounts across all territories and time periods.

title: Total Customer Count
additionalText:
Adventure Works currently has **19,820 total customers** in the system. This count includes both individual customers and store accounts across all sales territories and time periods.## MethodologyThe total customer count is calculated using `COUNT(DISTINCT customerid)` from the `customer` table, which serves as the canonical customer dimension in the Adventure Works data warehouse. This count represents all customers who have been registered in the system, regardless of their purchase history or current status. Total Customer Count
What is the total number of customers?
